alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Sanders (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 04 at 12:32PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Moderate to heavy rainfall and snowmelt will lead to rises in small streams and ponding of water... Where: Lincoln and Sanders counties in Montana When: Tuesday through Thursday What: A strong push of pacific moisture will produce moderate to heavy rain across northwest Montana, near the Idaho border. Warm temperatures will push snow levels above 8500 feet. The mild conditions will also lead to snow melt, which will combine with new rainfall to cause rises in small creeks and streams and ponding of water. Valley locations such as Yaak, Troy, and Libby have a 60-70 percent probability of receiving 1 inch or more of rainfall in a 48 hour period Tuesday through Thursday. Heron and Noxon have around a 50-60 percent probability of 1 inch or more. Yaak, Troy, and Libby also have a 10-20 percent probability of receiving 2 inches of rainfall. Peaks in the Cabinet Range will likely see 3 to 5 inches of liquid equivalent precipitation. Continue to monitor the forecast for updates.
